label: Anti-malware system maintenance and updates
quote: The contractor shall provide all maintenance for the system providing the anti-malware capabilities to include configuration, definition updates, and comply with DHS’ configuration management / release management requirements when changes are required.

label: Weekly anti-malware alert reporting to DHS COTR
quote: A summary of alerts shall be reported to DHS COTR in weekly status reports.

label: Notify DHS of anomalies per incident response plan
quote: If an abnormality or anomaly is identified, the contractor shall notify the appropriate DHS point of contact in accordance with the incident response plan.

label: Patch management services and deployment
quote: The Contractor shall perform provide patch management services. The contractor shall push patches that are required by vendors and the DHS system owner.

label: Deploy patches as directed by DHS
quote: the contractor shall be responsible for deploying patches as directed by DHS.

label: Test applications in test environment prior to deployment
quote: It is recommended that all other applications (host-based intrusion detection system (HIDS), network intrusion detection system (NIDS), Anti-malware, and Firewall) shall be tested by the contractor prior to deployment in a test environment.

label: Retain log files online and offline for specified periods
quote: Log files for all infrastructure devices, physical access, and anti-malware should be retained online for 180 days and offline for three years.

label: Provide manufacturer and supplier information for all components
quote: The Contractors supplying the Government hardware and software shall provide the manufacture’s name, address, state and/or domain of registration, and the Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number for all components comprising the hardware and software. If subcontractors or subcomponents are used, the name, address, state and/or domain of registration and DUNs number of those suppliers must also be provided.

label: Subcontractors subject to same requirements as prime contractors
quote: Subcontractors are subject to the same general requirements and standards as prime contractors.

label: Contractors must perform due diligence on subcontractors
quote: Contractors employing subcontractors shall perform due diligence to ensure that these standards are met.

label: Notify Government of new or changed supply chain entities
quote: The Government shall be notified when a new contractor/subcontractor/service provider is introduced to the supply chain, or when suppliers of parts or subcomponents are changed.

label: Provide, implement, and maintain Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
quote: Contractors shall provide, implement, and maintain a Supply Chain Risk Management Plan that addresses internal and external practices and controls employed to minimize the risk posed by counterfeits and vulnerabilities in systems, components, and software.

label: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan must describe protection processes
quote: The Plan shall describe the processes and procedures that will be followed to ensure appropriate supply chain protection of information system resources developed, processed, or used under this contract.

label: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan must address risk identification and management
quote: The Supply Chain Risk Management Plan shall address the following elements: 1. How risks from the supply chain will be identified, 2. What processes and security measures will be adopted to manage these risks to the system or system components, and 3. How the risks and associated security measures will be updated and monitored.

label: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan must remain current
quote: The Supply Chain Risk Management Plan shall remain current through the life of the contract or period of performance.

label: Submit Supply Chain Risk Management Plan to COTR post award
quote: The Supply Chain Risk Management Plan shall be provided to the Contracting Officer Technical Representative (COTR) 30 days post award.

label: Government may assess supply chain risk and terminate contract if unacceptable
quote: The Contractor acknowledges the Government's requirement to assess the Contractors Supply Chain Risk posture. The Contractor understands and agrees that the Government retains the right to cancel or terminate the contract, if the Government determines that continuing the contract presents an unacceptable risk to national security.

label: Disclose industry certifications and recognitions
quote: The Contractor shall disclose, and the Government will consider, relevant industry standards certifications, recognitions and awards, and acknowledgments.

label: Provide only new equipment unless approved by CO
quote: The Contractor shall provide only new equipment unless otherwise expressly approved, in writing, by the Contracting Officer (CO).

label: Replacement parts must be OEM if shipped OEM part fails
quote: In the event that a shipped OEM part fails, all replacement parts must be OEM parts.

label: Use non-new OEM components only with Government approval
quote: The Contractor shall be excused from using new OEM (i.e. 'grey market,' previously used) components only with formal Government approval.

label: Non-new OEM components from genuine source and authorized shipment points
quote: Such components shall be procured from their original genuine source and have the components shipped only from manufacturers authorized shipment points.

label: Provide all OEM software updates for product life
quote: For software products, the contractor shall provide all OEM software updates to correct defects for the life of the product (i.e. until the 'end of life.').

label: Make software updates and patches available for all procured products
quote: Software updates and patches must be made available to the government for all products procured under this contract.

label: Employ formal transit, storage, and delivery procedures for shipments
quote: Contractors shall employ formal and accountable transit, storage, and delivery procedures (i.e., the possession of the component is documented at all times from initial shipping point to final destination, and every transfer of the component from one custodian to another is fully documented and accountable) for all shipments to fulfill contract obligations with the Government.
